body_html:
Most directories don't have __init__.py because they are pulled up to be importable as tf.<name>. IE, you can see the list here https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/__init__.py

But also, things in python/tools directory are meant to be run as stand-alone scripts, not clear that it makes sense to have something like tf.freeze_graph
body_text:
Most directories don't have __init__.py because they are pulled up to be importable as tf.<name>. IE, you can see the list here  https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/__init__.py
But also, things in python/tools directory are meant to be run as stand-alone scripts, not clear that it makes sense to have something like tf.freeze_graph
body:
Most directories don't have `__init__.py` because they are pulled up to be importable as `tf.<name>`. IE, you can see the list here  https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/__init__.py

But also, things in python/tools directory are meant to be run as stand-alone scripts, not clear that it makes sense to have something like `tf.freeze_graph`
